issues.title: Unchecked CALL return value
issues.description: The call to winner.send(winAmount) at Lotto.sol:14 does not check the return value of the send() function. If the transfer fails, the execution continues and the payedOut state variable will be set to true, potentially leading to a loss of funds if the winner doesn't receive their winnings. It is recommended to check the return value and revert the transaction if the transfer fails.
issues.debug: Unchecked return value from send() operation

issues.title: State change after external call
issues.description: The contract performs a state change after an external call to winner.send(winAmount) at Lotto.sol:14. An attacker could trigger a reentrancy attack in the winner's fallback function to repeatedly withdraw funds before payedOut is set to true. Consider using the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern by updating the state before the external call.
issues.debug: State change after external call vulnerability

issues.title: Unchecked CALL return value
issues.description: The call to msg.sender.send(this.balance) at Lotto.sol:19 does not check the return value of the send() function. If the transfer fails, the execution continues. This can lead to a denial of service if the contract balance cannot be withdrawn. It is recommended to check the return value of the send() and revert the transaction if it fails.
issues.debug: Unchecked return value from send() operation
